Key Match Events: Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan put on 105 for the first wicket, achieving a century partnership.
Daryl Mitchell hit an unbeaten 53 off 35 balls.
Pakistan achieved their target of 152 with six balls to spare, winning by seven wickets.
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand struggled on a slow, dry pitch, making 4-152.
Pakistan chose to bat after winning the toss.
Five of the six teams who batted first at the SCG in T20 matches had won previously.
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson said it was very disappointing not to make Pakistan work harder for the win.
Babar Azam credited his bowlers and said it felt like they were playing at home.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand would have felt confident coming into the game, having thrashed Australia earlier in the tournament.
Pakistan's top trumps, Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan, showed their best form with a sublime display of hitting.
The Pakistan team demonstrated excellent fielding, with several players making crucial catches.
